name: Net Revenue Manager
description:
International pharmaceutical company
  • recognized as the Best Employer of 2021 by the Top Employer Institute;
  • the owner of the title "Dream Employer 2020" in the nomination "Development and Career" according to Medpred;
  • is the owner of the Employee Wellbeing Award 2020;
  • entered the top 3 best pharmaceutical companies for students with high potential in 2019 according to Changellenge;
  • 87% of employees are proud to work in our team


Responsibilities:
  • Pricing Champion / Brand portfolio pricing /Channel pricing/ Pack Price Architecture
  • Manage channel/customer segmentation
  • Strategic Trade of Terms / Gross to Net (G2N) management
  • Promotional effectiveness management
  • Active mix management
  • People Management


Requirements:
  • Ability to assimilate complex processes and business models, recommending alternative ways of working, strategic and flexible thinking in interaction with stakeholders at all levels across multiple functions, geographies and cultures
  • University Masters Level or formal Project Management qualification Commercial or finance
  • Able to influence and manage the highly matrixed organization at a senior level keeping a high pace of change
  • Strong communication skills and a high level of resilience
  • Experience of running complex projects with multiple deliverables and stakeholders
  • At least 5 years experience as Category Manager, Trade Marketing Manager or KAM or Finance. NRM Mgt preferably in Consumer Health care or FMCG
  • Strong problem solving and analytical skills
  • Ability to understand the commercial and financial impact of decisions and risks from a short term and strategic perspective
  • In-depth understand of P&L and impacts of changes in customer contracts on P&L
  • Detailed knowledge of usual and useful terms of trade and conditions in customer contracts and ways to optimise them
  • Awareness of Russian law, especially competition and cartel law as well as compliance regulations


Working conditions:
  • Agile and distributed decision-making - using evidence and applying judgement to balance pace, rigour and risk
  • Managing individual and team performance.
  • Committed to delivering high quality results, overcoming challenges, focusing on what matters, execution.
  • Implementing change initiatives and leading change.
  • Sustaining energy and well-being, building resilience in teams.
  • Continuously looking for opportunities to learn, build skills and share learning both internally and externally.
  • Developing people and building a talent pipeline.
  • Translating strategy into action - a compelling narrative, motivating others, setting objectives and delegation.
  • Building strong relationships and collaboration, managing trusted stakeholder relationships internally and externally.
  • Budgeting and forecasting, commercial and financial acumen.
